snippet.title: Employees, not hackers, cause most corporate data loss
snippet.description: ...Earlier this summer, we covered a report suggesting that the majority of corporate data loss comes... of corporate data losses this past year were due to hackers. Unfortunately, the good news mostly ends there. Negligent employees are far and away the largest cause of data breaches, but IT managers...

snippet.title: 2 Live Crew with kids in the room: Airdrive headphones review
snippet.description: ...Many headphones seek to make their mark by cutting you off from the rest of the world. Canalphones block out ambient noise and allow you to focus purely on the sounds you're hearing from your laptop, iPod, or other music device. The Airdrives go in a different direction, bringing you the sound from your device while allowing you to continue to hear what's going on around you.It's a...

snippet.title: EU reminds us to lose the distraction, turn the volume down
snippet.description: ...There was a time when I cranked out writing projects with a pair of headphones on, hard rock blasting directly into my auditory canal. The music created an odd sort of sonic mental insulation from the world around me that could be useful for tuning out roommates, spouses, the loud whispering couple in the library, or the chatty women at the coffee shop. But were there any long-time side effects f...

Having a mic hooked up to it and routed through my phone... that allows you to hear through walls. That might be my next implant actually."He also plans...

snippet.title: Apple rumored to ready wireless headphones for iOS devices
snippet.description: ...Apple appears to have purchased Wi-Gear, the company behind the iMuffs line of Bluetooth headphones designed for the iPod and iPhone. According to a source speaking to 9to5 Mac, the company plans to leverage the acquisition to develop its own stereo Bluetooth headphones for iPhones, iPads, and even...

snippet.title: Apple to replace problematic headphones with inline remote
snippet.description: ..., Apple has identified a potential defect in the inline remotes that may cause this problem and has a new program for replacing defective headphones free of charge.The problem mainly affects the Apple Headphones with Remote than came with iPod shuffles made between February 2009 and February 2010...
